segment.source: Checklist Creating Outbound Firewall Rules (Windows 10)
segment.target: Checklist Creating Outbound Firewall Rules (Windows 10)

segment.target: Checklist: Creating Outbound Firewall Rules

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview
segment.target: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview

segment.source: This checklist includes tasks for creating outbound firewall rules in your GPOs.
segment.target: This checklist includes tasks for creating outbound firewall rules in your GPOs.

segment.source: Important: By default, outbound filtering is disabled.
segment.target: Important: By default, outbound filtering is disabled.

segment.source: Because all outbound network traffic is permitted, outbound rules are typically used to block traffic that is not wanted on the network.
segment.target: Because all outbound network traffic is permitted, outbound rules are typically used to block traffic that is not wanted on the network.

segment.source: However, it is a best practice for an administrator to create outbound allow rules for those applications that are approved for use on the organization’s network.
segment.target: However, it is a best practice for an administrator to create outbound allow rules for those applications that are approved for use on the organization’s network.

segment.source: If you do this, then you have the option to set the default outbound behavior to block, preventing any network traffic that is not specifically authorized by the rules you create.
segment.target: If you do this, then you have the option to set the default outbound behavior to block, preventing any network traffic that is not specifically authorized by the rules you create.

segment.source: Checklist: Creating outbound firewall rules for Windows 8, Windows 7, Windows Vista, Windows Server 2012, Windows Server 2008, or Windows Server 2008 R2
segment.target: Checklist: Creating outbound firewall rules for Windows 8, Windows 7, Windows Vista, Windows Server 2012, Windows Server 2008, or Windows Server 2008 R2

segment.source: Task
segment.target: Task

segment.source: Reference
segment.target: Reference

segment.source: Create a rule that allows a program to send any outbound network traffic on any port it requires.
segment.target: Create a rule that allows a program to send any outbound network traffic on any port it requires.

segment.source: Create an Outbound Program or Service Rule
segment.target: Create an Outbound Program or Service Rule

segment.source: Create a rule that allows outbound network traffic on a specified port number.
segment.target: Create a rule that allows outbound network traffic on a specified port number.

segment.source: Create an Outbound Port Rule
segment.target: Create an Outbound Port Rule

segment.source: Enable a predefined rule or a group of predefined rules.
segment.target: Enable a predefined rule or a group of predefined rules.

segment.source: Some predefined rules for basic network services are included as part of the installation of Windows; others can be created when you install a new application or network service.
segment.target: Some predefined rules for basic network services are included as part of the installation of Windows; others can be created when you install a new application or network service.

segment.source: Enable Predefined Outbound Rules
segment.target: Enable Predefined Outbound Rules
